comment:
Based on the following profile, tasting the beer, home brewing, and BJCP judging experience, this recipe was written:
http://www.ratebeer.com/beer/10-barrel-hop-project-136-wheat-india-pale-ale/208446/
There needs to be a little something here regarding fermentation like yeast type, pitching volume, and the how and why of a fermentation strategy.

We opened two 12 oz. bottles; hoppy, with a big malty profile with wheat sweet tones; faint hop aroma, big head: maybe too big, some "spouting;" noticeable warming effect, great finish, I want more: this is a good beer!

This beer needs more more hop aroma and flavor; so, the next batch of "hoppy" beer will be dry-hopped much more; and, especially during secondary fermentation.
This beer displays a malty-sweet aroma with some of those "sharp" Galaxy hop notes in the background
